title: Two Sum
description: Given an array of integers nums and an integer target, return indices of the two numbers such that they add up to target.

steps.explanation: We have an array [2, 7, 11, 15] and target = 9. We need to find two numbers that sum to 9. The brute force approach would check every pair, but we can do better with a HashMap.
steps.tip: A HashMap allows O(1) lookup, so we can check if the complement exists instantly.

steps.explanation: Start at index 0. The current number is 2. The complement we need is target - current = 9 - 2 = 7. Check if 7 exists in the HashMap.
7 is not in the HashMap (it's empty). Store the current number (2) with its index (0) in the HashMap, then move to the next element.
Move to index 1. The current number is 7. The complement is 9 - 7 = 2. Check if 2 exists in the HashMap.
2 IS in the HashMap at index 0! We found our pair: nums[0] + nums[1] = 2 + 7 = 9. Return [0, 1].
steps.tip: Time complexity: O(n) - we traverse the array once. Space complexity: O(n) - we store at most n elements in the HashMap.
